purpose.summary: This policy establishes governance and treatment guidelines for windfall sales transactions and unusually large deals that have the potential to create disproportionate compensation outcomes. The policy ensures fair treatment of exceptional sales while maintaining the integrity and sustainability of the Company's sales compensation program.
objectives: Establish governance and treatment guidelines for windfall sales transactions and unusually large deals
Ensure fair treatment of exceptional sales while maintaining integrity and sustainability of compensation program
Provide clear criteria for identifying windfall transactions
Define treatment options for the Compensation Review Board
Maintain transparency and communication with sales representatives

appliesTo: All sales compensation plans with commission or bonus components
All sales roles across the Company divisions
Individual transactions and multi-transaction deals meeting windfall criteria
Both new business and expansion sales to existing customers

definitions.definition: A single sales transaction or series of related transactions that meets one or more of the windfall criteria defined in Section 4 of this policy.
A transaction with contract value exceeding $1,000,000 or resulting in commission payment exceeding $100,000.
A compensation result where a single transaction provides >50% of a sales representative's annual target incentive or >25% of annual quota attainment.
The documented activities, time investment, relationship building, and strategic selling work performed by the sales representative to close the transaction.
Spreading commission payments over multiple payment periods aligned with contract term or delivery schedule.
Dividing commission credit between multiple contributors based on their relative effort and contribution.

provisions.title: Windfall Identification Criteria
provisions.content: A transaction is classified as a potential windfall if it meets ANY of the following criteria:

subProvisions.title: Size-Based Criteria
subProvisions.content: Thresholds based on transaction value and compensation impact:
items: Transaction value exceeds $1,000,000
Commission payment would exceed $100,000
Single transaction represents >50% of annual quota
Deal would result in annual quota attainment >200%

subProvisions.title: Effort-Based Criteria
subProvisions.content: Criteria based on the level of sales effort relative to deal size:
items: Sales cycle was unusually short (<30 days) relative to deal size
Minimal sales rep involvement (customer-initiated inquiry, <5 touchpoints)
Significant corporate support/involvement beyond normal selling
Existing customer significantly expanding without competitive displacement

subProvisions.title: Circumstance-Based Criteria
subProvisions.content: Criteria based on external circumstances driving the deal:
items: Deal resulted from corporate partnership or alliance
Transaction driven primarily by marketing campaign or trade show
Merger/acquisition bringing large customer into territory
Industry consolidation creating large customer

provisions.title: Compensation Review Board (CRB) Review Process
provisions.content: Sales Compensation monitors all transactions and automatically flags potential windfalls based on criteria in Section 4. Flagged deals are held for CRB review before commission payment is processed.

subProvisions.title: Identification and Flagging
subProvisions.content: Sales Compensation monitors all transactions and automatically flags potential windfalls based on criteria in Section 4. Flagged deals are held for CRB review before commission payment is processed.

subProvisions.title: Information Package for CRB
subProvisions.content: For each windfall under review, the CRB receives:
items: Transaction details (size, scope, timeline)
Sales representative information (tenure, YTD performance, historical attainment)
Sales effort documentation (activities, timeline, customer interactions)
Commission calculation under standard plan rules
Sales manager assessment and recommendation
Comparable transaction analysis
Proposed treatment options with financial impact

subProvisions.title: Review Timeline
subProvisions.content: Target timeline from deal close to decision:
items: Flagged within 5 business days of deal closing
Information package prepared within 10 business days
CRB review completed within 15 business days
Decision communicated to sales rep within 2 business days of CRB meeting
Total timeline target: 30 days from deal close to decision

provisions.title: Windfall Treatment Options
provisions.content: The CRB may approve one or more of the following treatments based on the specific circumstances:

subProvisions.title: Option 1: Full Payment Under Plan (No Modification)
subProvisions.content: Pay commission according to standard plan terms without modification. Used when sales rep demonstrated exceptional effort and sales strategy, deal was fully within rep's control and influence, competitive win or complex sales process, or rep's overall performance is at or below target.
items: Sales rep demonstrated exceptional effort and sales strategy
Deal was fully within rep's control and influence
Competitive win or complex sales process
Rep's overall performance is at or below target

subProvisions.title: Option 2: Commission Cap
subProvisions.content: Applied when transaction significantly exceeds typical deal size for role, some sales effort but not commensurate with commission amount, or need to maintain reasonable compensation/performance relationship.
items: Cap commission at 2x annual target incentive
Cap at 150% of annual quota attainment contribution
Cap at $250,000 total commission payment
Any excess commission above cap is absorbed (not paid)

subProvisions.title: Option 3: Amortization
subProvisions.content: Used for multi-year contracts or phased delivery, payment timing misalignment with value delivery, or risk mitigation for contract cancellation or non-payment.
items: Spread commission payments over contract term (up to 36 months)
Align payments with customer payment milestones
Align payments with product/service delivery schedule
Payments subject to continued employment (unless otherwise specified)

subProvisions.title: Option 4: Split Credit
subProvisions.content: Used when multiple parties significantly contributed to sale, corporate team involvement, or transition from previous rep or inherited relationship.
items: Allocate commission among contributors based on documented effort
Primary rep typically receives 50-70% of credit
Supporting contributors receive 10-30% each
Total allocation may exceed 100% for exceptional team selling

subProvisions.title: Option 5: Special Recognition Bonus
subProvisions.content: Used when deal has strategic importance beyond commission value, rep went above and beyond normal expectations, or to recognize effort while modifying standard commission.
items: Award discretionary bonus separate from commission plan
Typical range: $25,000 - $100,000
May be combined with capped or amortized commission
Approved by CRB with CEO sign-off

subProvisions.title: Combination Approaches
subProvisions.content: The CRB may approve a combination of treatments. For example:
items: Amortize commission over 3 years AND apply a $200K cap
Split credit 70/30 AND provide special recognition bonus
Cap commission at $150K AND amortize payment over 2 years

provisions.title: Documentation and Approval Workflow
provisions.content: Comprehensive documentation requirements for all windfall reviews.

subProvisions.title: Windfall Review Form
subProvisions.content: Required information for all windfall reviews:
items: Transaction identification and details
Sales representative profile
Windfall criteria met
Sales effort assessment (completed by manager)
Standard commission calculation
Comparable deals analysis
Recommended treatment with rationale
Financial impact summary

subProvisions.title: Sales Manager Input
subProvisions.content: The direct sales manager must provide:
items: Assessment of sales rep's effort level (scale 1-5)
Chronology of sales activities
Competitive situation assessment
Unique circumstances or context
Recommendation for treatment
Impact assessment on rep morale and motivation

subProvisions.title: CRB Decision Documentation
subProvisions.content: The CRB decision record includes:
items: Meeting date and attendees
Summary of discussion and considerations
Treatment decision with specific terms
Rationale for decision
Vote results (if not unanimous)
Effective date and payment schedule
Communication plan for sales rep

subProvisions.title: Retention Period
subProvisions.content: All windfall review documentation is retained for seven (7) years in accordance with the Company's data retention policy.

provisions.title: Transparency and Communication
provisions.content: Requirements for communicating the policy and windfall decisions to sales team members.

subProvisions.title: Policy Communication
subProvisions.content: This policy is communicated to all sales team members:
items: Included in annual compensation plan document
Referenced in offer letters and employment agreements
Reviewed during new hire onboarding
Reinforced in annual sales meetings

subProvisions.title: Notification to Sales Representative
subProvisions.content: When a windfall is identified:
items: Rep is notified within 5 days of deal flagging
Explanation of review process and timeline
Opportunity for rep to provide input and documentation
Rep may request meeting with manager to discuss

subProvisions.title: Decision Communication
subProvisions.content: Following CRB decision:
items: Written notification within 2 business days
Clear explanation of treatment and rationale
Updated commission calculation
Payment schedule (if amortized)
Appeal rights and process

subProvisions.title: Annual Reporting
subProvisions.content: Sales Compensation provides annual summary to executive leadership:
items: Number of windfall reviews conducted
Treatment outcomes distribution
Financial impact (commissions paid vs. modified)
Policy effectiveness assessment

provisions.title: Appeal Process
provisions.content: Sales representatives may appeal windfall treatment decisions.

subProvisions.title: Initial Appeal
subProvisions.content: First-level appeal process:
items: Submit written appeal within 15 days of decision notification
Provide additional documentation supporting full payment
CRB reviews new information
Decision within 10 business days

subProvisions.title: Executive Review
subProvisions.content: Second-level appeal if unsatisfied with initial appeal outcome:
items: Escalate to SVP of Sales and CFO
Executive review within 10 business days
May adjust treatment or uphold CRB decision
Executive decision is final

provisions.title: Roles and Responsibilities
provisions.content: Clearly defined roles for all parties involved in the windfall review process.

subProvisions.title: Sales Compensation Team
subProvisions.content: Primary responsibilities:
items: Monitor transactions against windfall criteria
Flag potential windfalls for review
Prepare information packages for CRB
Process approved payments according to CRB decision
Maintain windfall review documentation

subProvisions.title: Sales Managers
subProvisions.content: Manager responsibilities:
items: Provide sales effort assessment for windfall reviews
Submit recommendations to CRB
Communicate decisions to sales reps
Support reps through review and appeal process

subProvisions.title: Compensation Review Board
subProvisions.content: CRB responsibilities:
items: Review flagged windfall transactions
Determine appropriate treatment
Document decisions and rationale
Review appeals and render final decisions

subProvisions.title: Finance
subProvisions.content: Financial oversight:
items: Validate transaction financial data
Assess financial impact of treatment options
Approve payments exceeding standard thresholds

subProvisions.title: Legal
subProvisions.content: Legal compliance:
items: Review treatment decisions for compliance
Advise on contractual obligations
Review appeal determinations
